ygData.subject: Re: Trading Advice
ygData.msgSnippet: To bad me blacklisting someone in my book doesn t mean anything ;-).  I ve got a list of about 10 KS ers and 2 Ninja looters.  I tend to only party with
ygData.messageBody:
To bad me blacklisting someone in my book doesn't mean anything ;-). I've
got a list of about 10 KS'ers and 2 "Ninja" looters. I tend to only party
with people I know or people from my guild now. I hate that bad taste in my
mouth when I get screwed.


----- Original Message -----
From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 04, 2000 11:01 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Trading Advice


> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
> > I take it this is what Ninja'ing is?
>
> You are wise, young John_Senior, in the art of ninjalooting.
>
> hehehe...
>
> Loot and scoot... They log so they don't get flooded with
> lots of cursing and threats, and then hopefully people forget
> about them. Not this bard... if anyone pulls that shit, I write
> your name down in a little book I have next to my computer.
> Being blacklisted for the rest of your EQ career kinda sucks.
>
> Harm.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
